  "title": "Estate Officer",
  "description": "Federal College of Education, Eha-Amufu, Enugu State, invites applications from suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Estate Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Eha-Amufu, Enugu

Requirements


	Candidates should possess a good&nbsp;Honours Degree of not below second class lower or HND in Estate Mangement or related discipline.
	Possession of professional certificate in&nbsp;Estate Mangement will be an advantage.


General&nbsp;Requirements:


	Applicants must not be less than 18 years and not more than 55 years of age.
	Applicants who are physically challenged should state the nature of their disability.


Salary Grade
CONTEDISS 7.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates who meet the conditions as stated above are required to submit five (5) copies of their applications and current Curriculum Vitae (CV). All applications should be addressed to the:
The Registrar,
Federal College of Education,
Eha-Amufu, Enugu State.

Note:&nbsp;Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-08",

Estate Officer Job at Federal College of Education




        
    

        
        Federal College of Education, Eha-Amufu, Enugu State, invites applications from suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Estate Officer

Job Location: Eha-Amufu, Enugu

Requirements


	Candidates should possess a good Honours Degree of not below second class lower or HND in Estate Mangement or related discipline.
	Possession of professional certificate in Estate Mangement will be an advantage.


General Requirements:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Applicants must not be less than 18 years and not more than 55 years of age.
	Applicants who are physically challenged should state the nature of their disability.


Salary Grade
CONTEDISS 7.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates who meet the conditions as stated above are required to submit five (5) copies of their applications and current Curriculum Vitae (CV). All applications should be addressed to the:
The Registrar,
Federal College of Education,
Eha-Amufu, Enugu State.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Storekeeper",
  "description": "Perfection Motors, a subsidiary of the Lee Group of companies was established in partnership with FAW China. Perfection Motor&rsquo;s was given the sole rights to, assemble and market FAW heavy duty Trucks in Nigeria. Since our inception in 2013 we have made great strides in insuring that we will be ready to service our market by establishing our head office alongside a fully equipped workshop, Parts Department and not to mention an SKD assembly plant in Ikeja.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Storekeeper

Job Location:&nbsp;&nbsp;Kano
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Scrutinizing incoming spare part orders to ensure that part members / descriptions correlate to what is physically received and stock counts balance to the waybills and other shipping documents.
	To ensure that the outgoing spare part orders are accurately fulfilled and that despatch documents strictly adhere to the requirements of company rules, policies, and procedures.
	Responsible for the label monitoring of spare parts and the upkeep of all bin storage area specification signage.
	Responsible for inventory control and reporting, inclusive of conducting accurate stock counts as instructed by the spares department supervisor.
	Custodian of housekeeping and compliance with all health and safety protocols and procedures with in The store.
	Maintain the control of physical documentation and to keep all document files in good order.
	Regular audits of workshop tools and reporting of damaged, or missingparts to the Supervisor.
	Monitoring and receiving purchase parts as well as reconciliation with the mechanics and service team.


Skills and Qualifications


	Certificate III in Warehouse preferred, but not essential
	Ability to manage complexity at varying levels and adapt quickly to changes in job priorities
	Computer literate with the familiarity of use with recognized inventory management programs or similar MS Office software applications
	Exceptional customer service skills
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	Knowledge on truck spares
	Organizationalskills and attention to detail
	Ability to stand for long periods
	Knowledge of point of sale software
	Strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills
	In-depth knowledge of stocked merchandise
	Male Applicants only
	Excellent Time Management Skills and the ability to prioritize workloads to meet standards.
	Experience within a similar position with a good knowledge of goods movement and inventory practices
	Good Knowledge of truck spares.


Salary
N50,000 - N85,000 monthly.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs and Applications to:&nbsp;deborahjames050@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-31",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Perfection Motors"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",

    }

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

Storekeeper Job at Perfection Motors




        
    

        
        Perfection Motors, a subsidiary of the Lee Group of companies was established in partnership with FAW China. Perfection Motor’s was given the sole rights to, assemble and market FAW heavy duty Trucks in Nigeria. Since our inception in 2013 we have made great strides in insuring that we will be ready to service our market by establishing our head office alongside a fully equipped workshop, Parts Department and not to mention an SKD assembly plant in Ikeja.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Storekeeper

Job Location:  Kano
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Scrutinizing incoming spare part orders to ensure that part members / descriptions correlate to what is physically received and stock counts balance to the waybills and other shipping documents.
	To ensure that the outgoing spare part orders are accurately fulfilled and that despatch documents strictly adhere to the requirements of company rules, policies, and procedures.
	Responsible for the label monitoring of spare parts and the upkeep of all bin storage area specification signage.
	Responsible for inventory control and reporting, inclusive of conducting accurate stock counts as instructed by the spares department supervisor.
	Custodian of housekeeping and compliance with all health and safety protocols and procedures with in The store.
	Maintain the control of physical documentation and to keep all document files in good order.
	Regular audits of workshop tools and reporting of damaged, or missingparts to the Supervisor.
	Monitoring and receiving purchase parts as well as reconciliation with the mechanics and service team.


Skills and Qualifications


	Certificate III in Warehouse preferred, but not essential
	Ability to manage complexity at varying levels and adapt quickly to changes in job priorities
	Computer literate with the familiarity of use with recognized inventory management programs or similar MS Office software applications
	Exceptional customer service skills
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	Knowledge on truck spares
	Organizationalskills and attention to detail
	Ability to stand for long periods
	Knowledge of point of sale software
	Strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills
	In-depth knowledge of stocked merchandise
	Male Applicants only
	Excellent Time Management Skills and the ability to prioritize workloads to meet standards.
	Experience within a similar position with a good knowledge of goods movement and inventory practices
	Good Knowledge of truck spares.


Salary
N50,000 - N85,000 monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs and Applications to: deborahjames050@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

  "description": "Federal College of Education, Eha-Amufu, Enugu State, invites applications from suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Medical Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Eha-Amufu, Enugu

Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Degree in Medicine Registerabie with the Medical and Dental Council of Nigeria from recognized Institution and a Minimum of 3 years post registration experience plus NYSC Discharge/Exclusion Exemption letter.


General&nbsp;Requirements


	Applicants must not be less than 18 years and not more than 55 years of age.
	Applicants who are physically challenged should state the nature of their disability.


Salary Grade
CONMESS 02.

The Registrar,
Federal College of Education,
Eha-Amufu, Enugu State.

Medical Officer Job at Federal College of Education




        
    

        
        Federal College of Education, Eha-Amufu, Enugu State, invites applications from suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Medical Officer

Job Location: Eha-Amufu, Enugu

Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Degree in Medicine Registerabie with the Medical and Dental Council of Nigeria from recognized Institution and a Minimum of 3 years post registration experience plus NYSC Discharge/Exclusion Exemption letter.


General Requirements
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Applicants must not be less than 18 years and not more than 55 years of age.
	Applicants who are physically challenged should state the nature of their disability.


Salary Grade
CONMESS 02.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates who meet the conditions as stated above are required to submit five (5) copies of their applications and current Curriculum Vitae (CV). All applications should be addressed to the:
The Registrar,
Federal College of Education,
Eha-Amufu, Enugu State.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Strategic Research Analyst",
  "description": "Primeguage Solutions Limited, since our establishment, have become the fastest-growing revenue management and technology consulting firm in Nigeria. Driven by passion and hard work, we help our clients build stronger, more agile, and innovative businesses. Rather than dwell on our past achievements, we look forward to the enormous opportunities that are emerging from the growing shift to digital business. We invest in new solutions and acquisitions, build our capabilities, and develop our teams to ensure that Primeguage is well-positioned to help clients explore the vast opportunity &ndash; and deliver on the potential &ndash; of this new digital business era.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Strategic Research Analyst

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	Supports delivery of strategic projects within budget, time, and scope by driving research, insights, and cross-departmental collaboration to improve business processes and strategy execution.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop internal OKRs and SLAs to uphold high performance standards.
	Lead forward-looking research on industry trends, policies, competitors, and markets.
	Produce strategic reports, white papers, and briefing notes with actionable insights.
	Provide input on business planning, identifying growth opportunities and risks.
	Oversee use of BI tools (Power BI, Tableau) ensuring alignment with business goals.
	Collaborate with product, marketing, and executive teams to embed insights in decision-making.
	Use Canva/PowerPoint to design clear, visually engaging reports and strategy decks
	Analyze government policies and sector programs for business implications.
	Promote innovation and evidence-based planning through strategic foresight.
	Deliver performance insights and benchmarking using existing tools.
	Support teams in interpreting BI insights and applying them effectively.


Skills &amp; Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s / Master&rsquo;s Degree in Strategic Management, Business, Development Studies, or Public Policy.
	4 - 6 years of experience in strategy, research, or business intelligence roles.
	Proven ability to translate research into executive insights.
	Familiarity with Power BI/Tableau.
	Strong communication, collaboration, and stakeholder management.
	Skilled in visual presentation tools.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 monthly.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@primeguage.co&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Strategic Research Analyst Job at Primeguage Solutions Limited




        
    

        
        Primeguage Solutions Limited, since our establishment, have become the fastest-growing revenue management and technology consulting firm in Nigeria. Driven by passion and hard work, we help our clients build stronger, more agile, and innovative businesses. Rather than dwell on our past achievements, we look forward to the enormous opportunities that are emerging from the growing shift to digital business. We invest in new solutions and acquisitions, build our capabilities, and develop our teams to ensure that Primeguage is well-positioned to help clients explore the vast opportunity – and deliver on the potential – of this new digital business era.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Strategic Research Analyst

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	Supports delivery of strategic projects within budget, time, and scope by driving research, insights, and cross-departmental collaboration to improve business processes and strategy execution.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop internal OKRs and SLAs to uphold high performance standards.
	Lead forward-looking research on industry trends, policies, competitors, and markets.
	Produce strategic reports, white papers, and briefing notes with actionable insights.
	Provide input on business planning, identifying growth opportunities and risks.
	Oversee use of BI tools (Power BI, Tableau) ensuring alignment with business goals.
	Collaborate with product, marketing, and executive teams to embed insights in decision-making.
	Use Canva/PowerPoint to design clear, visually engaging reports and strategy decks
	Analyze government policies and sector programs for business implications.
	Promote innovation and evidence-based planning through strategic foresight.
	Deliver performance insights and benchmarking using existing tools.
	Support teams in interpreting BI insights and applying them effectively.


Skills & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s / Master’s Degree in Strategic Management, Business, Development Studies, or Public Policy.
	4 - 6 years of experience in strategy, research, or business intelligence roles.
	Proven ability to translate research into executive insights.
	Familiarity with Power BI/Tableau.
	Strong communication, collaboration, and stakeholder management.
	Skilled in visual presentation tools.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@primeguage.co using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Finance and Administrative Officer",
  "description": "Green Habitat Initiative (GHI) is a non-governmental organization dedicated to promoting environmental sustainability, climate resilience, and improved livelihoods across Nigeria. GHI designs and implements community-based initiatives that address climate change, renewable energy, sustainable agriculture, and green innovation.

As part of its ongoing organizational strengthening and commitment to operational excellence, GHI is seeking to engage a highly competent and experienced Finance and Administrative Officer. The officer will provide leadership in managing the organization&rsquo;s financial and administrative functions, ensuring effective financial planning, regulatory compliance, and efficient internal operations that support GHI&rsquo;s strategic objectives and program implementation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance and Administrative Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Contract

Key Responsibilities
Financial Management and Reporting:


	Oversee all accounting transactions, ensuring accuracy, transparency, and compliance with financial regulations and internal controls.
	Supervise and reconcile accounts payable and receivable; ensure timely bank payments and maintain strong relationships with financial institutions.
	Lead the preparation and monitoring of annual and project budgets, including expenditure tracking, variance analysis, and financial forecasting.
	Prepare and review monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports for management and donors.
	Coordinate annual audits and ensure the implementation of audit recommendations.


Administration and Operations:


	Ensure effective office administration, logistics coordination, procurement, and asset management across all departments.
	Supervise payroll processing, statutory deductions, and HR administrative functions like staff records, leave management, and welfare.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date administrative and financial documentation in line with organizational and statutory requirements.
	Lead the development and enforcement of financial and administrative policies and procedures.


Collaboration and Leadership:


	Work closely with senior management to support strategic planning, financial sustainability, and resource allocation.
	Collaborate with team members across departments to ensure smooth coordination of administrative, IT, and financial activities.
	Communicate effectively with stakeholders, partners, and vendors to address inquiries, resolve issues, and coordinate correspondence.


Required personal competencies:


	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Sustainability Knowledge: Knowledge of the sustainability agenda and its relationship with business. Must possess a strong interest in driving corporate action on sustainable development. Must have an international and innovative outlook and mindset.
	Computer/Technical Skills: Advanced proficiency in MS Office Suite (Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint). Experience using project management software (e.g., Clickup, Slack, etc) is desirable.


Qualifications and Required Experiences


	A Bachelor&#39;s and Master&#39;s (required) Degree in Accounting, Finance, or any related field is required.
	A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience, preferably in the NGO or development sector.
	Professional certification, such as ACA or ACCA, is required.
	Strong proficiency in QuickBooks, Microsoft Excel, and other accounting software is essential.
	Good understanding and knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles, financial management practices, and internal control systems.


Core Values:


	Integrity: Prioritise honest communication, ethical decision-making, accountability, and fair treatment of team members. Foster a culture of trust and reliability within the team.
	Strategic: Holds a clear, forward-thinking vision for the project and its impact. They align actions with long-term strategic objectives to drive organisational success.
	Innovation: Encouraging creative thinking and novel approaches within the project team, value the identification of efficient solutions to challenges and the continuous improvement of processes.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application documents to:&nbsp;careers@greenhabitat.ng&nbsp;using &ldquo;Finance and Administrative Officer&rdquo; as the subject of the email.

Application Guidelines


	Kindly upload your CV. It should be 2 pages maximum. Name the file as CV_FirstName_LastName and in PDF format.
	We are more interested in learning about your achievements in your previous experiences than your daily tasks. We advise you to focus on 3 to 4 major achievements for each of your current/past roles.
	Cover letter. 1 page maximum. Name the file as CL_FirstName_LastName&nbsp; in PDF format.&nbsp;
	We will read your CV and come to know of your achievements. Therefore, your cover letter should not be a repetition of your CV. Instead, use it to succinctly inform us what unique value you will bring by joining us that is not mentioned anywhere in your application. Tell us why you will be the best candidate to manage this project.


Note


	Any file submissions that violate the submission guidelines will not be considered.&nbsp;
	Ensure your contact details are updated.
	The application will close once the right candidate is found. Interested applicants are advised to apply as soon as possible.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-31",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-22",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Green Habitat Initiative (GHI)"
    
  },

}



Finance and Administrative Officer Job at Green Habitat Initiative (GHI)




        
    

        
        Green Habitat Initiative (GHI) is a non-governmental organization dedicated to promoting environmental sustainability, climate resilience, and improved livelihoods across Nigeria. GHI designs and implements community-based initiatives that address climate change, renewable energy, sustainable agriculture, and green innovation.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



As part of its ongoing organizational strengthening and commitment to operational excellence, GHI is seeking to engage a highly competent and experienced Finance and Administrative Officer. The officer will provide leadership in managing the organization’s financial and administrative functions, ensuring effective financial planning, regulatory compliance, and efficient internal operations that support GHI’s strategic objectives and program implementation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance and Administrative Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Contract

Key Responsibilities
Financial Management and Reporting:


	Oversee all accounting transactions, ensuring accuracy, transparency, and compliance with financial regulations and internal controls.
	Supervise and reconcile accounts payable and receivable; ensure timely bank payments and maintain strong relationships with financial institutions.
	Lead the preparation and monitoring of annual and project budgets, including expenditure tracking, variance analysis, and financial forecasting.
	Prepare and review monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports for management and donors.
	Coordinate annual audits and ensure the implementation of audit recommendations.


Administration and Operations:


	Ensure effective office administration, logistics coordination, procurement, and asset management across all departments.
	Supervise payroll processing, statutory deductions, and HR administrative functions like staff records, leave management, and welfare.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date administrative and financial documentation in line with organizational and statutory requirements.
	Lead the development and enforcement of financial and administrative policies and procedures.


Collaboration and Leadership:


	Work closely with senior management to support strategic planning, financial sustainability, and resource allocation.
	Collaborate with team members across departments to ensure smooth coordination of administrative, IT, and financial activities.
	Communicate effectively with stakeholders, partners, and vendors to address inquiries, resolve issues, and coordinate correspondence.


Required personal competencies:


	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Sustainability Knowledge: Knowledge of the sustainability agenda and its relationship with business. Must possess a strong interest in driving corporate action on sustainable development. Must have an international and innovative outlook and mindset.
	Computer/Technical Skills: Advanced proficiency in MS Office Suite (Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint). Experience using project management software (e.g., Clickup, Slack, etc) is desirable.


Qualifications and Required Experiences


	A Bachelor's and Master's (required) Degree in Accounting, Finance, or any related field is required.
	A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience, preferably in the NGO or development sector.
	Professional certification, such as ACA or ACCA, is required.
	Strong proficiency in QuickBooks, Microsoft Excel, and other accounting software is essential.
	Good understanding and knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles, financial management practices, and internal control systems.


Core Values:


	Integrity: Prioritise honest communication, ethical decision-making, accountability, and fair treatment of team members. Foster a culture of trust and reliability within the team.
	Strategic: Holds a clear, forward-thinking vision for the project and its impact. They align actions with long-term strategic objectives to drive organisational success.
	Innovation: Encouraging creative thinking and novel approaches within the project team, value the identification of efficient solutions to challenges and the continuous improvement of processes.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application documents to: careers@greenhabitat.ng using “Finance and Administrative Officer” as the subject of the email.

Application Guidelines


	Kindly upload your CV. It should be 2 pages maximum. Name the file as CV_FirstName_LastName and in PDF format.
	We are more interested in learning about your achievements in your previous experiences than your daily tasks. We advise you to focus on 3 to 4 major achievements for each of your current/past roles.
	Cover letter. 1 page maximum. Name the file as CL_FirstName_LastName  in PDF format. 
	We will read your CV and come to know of your achievements. Therefore, your cover letter should not be a repetition of your CV. Instead, use it to succinctly inform us what unique value you will bring by joining us that is not mentioned anywhere in your application. Tell us why you will be the best candidate to manage this project.


Note


	Any file submissions that violate the submission guidelines will not be considered. 
	Ensure your contact details are updated.
	The application will close once the right candidate is found. Interested applicants are advised to apply as soon as possible.
